poem:
Title: "In Palms of a Mother"

In rooted stillness—
an Arctic shadow surrendered
under Moscow's blink,
unfurled after nine days. 
A body, once fireside with dissent,
now in maternal hands. 
Soft plea hung like fog:
will they allow fellow mourners
to shadow our loss?
Silent thanks to all voices,
echoed in the cool quiet.
Not knowing, yet holding—
the weight of requiem.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Alexei Navalny’s body given to mother by Russian authorities The body of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny has been handed over to his mother nine days after he died in an Arctic prison, his spokesperson announced on Saturday. In a post on X, Kira Yarmysh thanked “all those who had demanded” the return of his body, but added that she did not know if the authorities would allow a public funeral to be held. “The". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
